acn-autosys.name: Accenture: Statens Vegvesen (SVV)
acn-autosys.ingress: 2019 Aug to Today - Full stack application developer
acn-autosys.who: Statens Vegvesen is a norwegian state agency responsible for building and maintaining all roads and highways and manage all vehicles and car owners in the country. The project is a migration project named "Autosys"
acn-autosys.goal: We develop a new application to handle SVV's 15 million registered vehicles and 20,000 users. The application replaces their existing main frame solution. It serves 1,500 internal caseworkers and external actors like insurance companies and the norwegian police. The project consists of 50 developers working in autonomous SCRUM teams of 6 to 12 with a solution designs team and a management team.
acn-autosys.results: I am developing full stack in a team of 12 and continuously deliver functionality. There has been strong focus on high quality code and robust unit and integration tests. We also collaborate closely with the customer.

acn-picterus.name: Accenture: Picterus
acn-picterus.ingress: 2019 May to 2019 Aug - Computer vision Against Neonatal Jaundice
acn-picterus.who: Picterus is a medical startup developing a mobile app for detecting jaundice in newborns. Jaundice is a condition that arises from the accumulation of bilirubin in the blood. It is estimated that jaundice kills around 114,000 newborns each year. Picterus' app estimates the levels of bilirubin in the blood using mobile camera images.
acn-picterus.goal: Answer whether it was feasible to estimate bilirubin concentration from images using machine learning, i.e. modern computer vision. In addition, compare the performance of the trained models with the existing estimation model based on traditional computer vision.
acn-picterus.results: We were able to train models that outperformed Picterus' existing model. In addition, we optimized the model to be able to run locally on a mobile device. This eliminates the bottlenecks of sending health data across borders because images no longer needs to be processed on an external server. A well developed IT infrastructure is not always the case in underdeveloped countries. By using convolutional neural networks that can process images and metadata simultaneously we achieved a correlation coefficient of 0.9 on a randomly selected test set. For comparison, Picterus' model gave a correlation coefficient of 0.6 on the same test set. We also gave specific suggestions on how data collection can take place in the future.

acn-liquid.name: Accenture: Liquid Studio
acn-liquid.ingress: 2018 Aug to 2019 May - AI business development
acn-liquid.who: Accenture Liquid Studios provide rapid technology development and embrace new technologies, skillsets and ways of working.
acn-liquid.goal: The studios function as the core part of Accenture's innovation architecture and deliver prototypes and software to help companies enter new markets. The work includes uncovering AI possibilities at existing Accenture projects and establishing AI capabilities within Accenture. In other words, we attempt to create and implement useful AI-solutions for our clients.
acn-liquid.results: We have held several client workshops assessing machine learning opportunities in their business and given advice on how to build capabilities within the field. Our studio delivered various prototypes and proof of concepts, like spare part demand prediction for a car importer.

tronderenergi.name: TrønderEnergi AS
tronderenergi.ingress: 2019 Jan to 2019 May - Predicting wind power with machine learning
tronderenergi.who: TrønderEnergi is an energy production company in Trondheim - Norway - which produces and sell electric energy. They own several wind mill farms and strive towards making energy a sustainable resource.
tronderenergi.goal: Every day, TrønderEnergi places bids on the energy market to sell their power production. If they produce less than their bid, they have to pay penalty fines to fill in the underproduction. However, if they produce more than their bid, they have power production they’re unable to sell. Wind power is solely dependant on the weather. Therefore, they wish to be able to predict their power production based on the weather forecast the next 24 hours. The goal of our project was to perform data analysis and develop machine learning models to better predict their production given external factors.
tronderenergi.results: We performed data visualization and analysis, interviews of domain experts and development of prediction models. The data contained weather and operational data. prediction objective was minimizing the monetary loss of non-optimal commandments on the energy market. As a result, we were able to deploy a simple prediction model to be monitored and compared with their existing prediction modelling. On some of their wind mill farms we were able to show a prediction accuracy improvement of 24% on the mean square error.

statnet.name: Statnett
statnet.ingress: 2017 Jun to 2017 Aug - Facilities management with machine learning
statnet.who: Statnett SF is a Norwegian state-owned enterprise responsible for developing, owning and operating the central electricity grid, including cables and wires connected to other countries.
statnet.goal: I was a developer in an interdisciplinary team of six students. Our task was to improve facilities management in Statnett with a freely defined solution. Our team performed an assessment of relevant challenges and proposed a pilot project we wanted to execute.
statnet.results: The solution was a machine learning model that predicted temperature development in electricity transformers by using historical sensor data and external weather data. By using this prediction we can increase the lifespan and reduce operating expenses of power transformers in the power grid. Data engineering was necessary to extract the relevant data from Statnett's database. It was estimated that utilizing such predictive maintenance models in their system, Statnett could potentially save 500M NOK in a span of 10 years.

reno.name: Renovasjonsetaten
reno.ingress: 2016 Jun to 2016 Sep - Automatic garbage disposal tracking with RFID
reno.who: Oslo Renovasjonsetaten is the state agency of responsible for all garbage collection in Oslo.
reno.goal: Reno's goal is to automate and digitize Oslo's waste management and implement digital tracking of all garbage disposal trucks. We worked with implementing an RFID tracking system to track the progress of garbage disposal trucks in real time.
reno.results: We were able to mark some garbage collection routes with RFID chips and test the system with an RFID reader installed on a garbage truck. This setup automatically registered which garbage containers we had visited.
